intro: Rapistrum hispanicum, commonly known as Spanish rapeseed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
